section.title: Welcome to Llamda’s Documentation
section.paragraph: Llamda is a Python library that provides easy-to-use decorators for making your functions and Pydantic models compatible with Large Language Models (LLMs).

section.title: Installation
section.paragraph: You can install Llamda using pip:

section.title: Quick Start
section.paragraph: Here’s a simple example of how to use Llamda:
section.literal_block:
from llamda_fn import Llamda from typing import List
llamda = Llamda()
@llamda.llamdafy() def greet(name: str, times: int = 1) -> str: """Greet a person multiple times.""" return f"Hello, {name}! " * times
# Use the function result = greet("Alice", 3) print(result) # Output: Hello, Alice! Hello, Alice! Hello, Alice!
# Get the JSON schema schema = llamda.tools["greet"].to_schema() print(schema)
